abstracts.cdata!:
The Gansu/Xinjiang Pastoral Development
            Project is a livestock development project which covers 14
            counties/cities in Gansu and 32 counties in Xinjiang-Uyghur.
            The following environmental impacts are considered common to
            all project areas. Feed processing operations are believed
            to be on a small scale and mostly run by households and
            herders. The major potential environmental impacts are dusts
            and noise, which will be minimized especially in residential
            areas by putting crushing machines indoors. Wool packing
            will not involve use of chemicals and so no wastewater from
            wool washing is anticipated. However the operation should be
            standardized and managed according to the principle of
            minimum impact to the environment. Dead animals should
            either be sent to the local epidemic prevention station for
            disposals or be disposed in a centralized way to prevent
            cross infection and environmental pollution. Chemical used
            in the laboratories should be stored properly by type and
            according to the management regulations for toxic materials.
            After use, the chemicals should be properly handled and sent
            to the designated disposal sites. Feedlots produce
            significant quantities of farmyard manure (organic waste)
            rich in nitrogen and phosphorus, which could potentially
            pollute groundwater and surface water. It is necessary to
            keep manure in sedimentation ponds for a period of time
            before applying to agricultural fields and artificial pastures.
